meanings.definition: To remove the spleen from (a person or animal).
meanings.sent1: The surgeon splenectomized the patient to treat a serious medical condition.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian splenectomized the dog to improve its health.
meanings.sent3: After the surgery, the spleen was splenectomized and put in a jar as a strange souvenir.
meanings.sent4: The removal of the spleen splenectomized the body, altering its immune system.
meanings.sent5: The act of splenectomizing can have significant effects on overall health.

meanings.sent1: The splenectomized patient needed to take extra precautions to avoid infections.
meanings.sent2: The splenectomized individual had to adjust to life without a spleen.
meanings.sent3: The splenectomized person joked about being 'half-empty' after the surgery.
meanings.sent4: Her splenectomized state made her more susceptible to certain illnesses.
meanings.sent5: The splenectomized man felt lighter without his spleen, both physically and metaphorically.
